sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content:
Dir.Delete is used to delete the directory specified by the parameter directoryPathName. This is the equivalent of doing a rmdir in DOS or UNIX. On the Macintosh, it removes a folder.

Dir.Delete will fail if it attempts delete a directory that has files in it.
sections.text_content:
Dir.Delete is used to delete the directory specified by the parameter directoryPathName. This is the equivalent of doing a rmdir in DOS or UNIX. On the Macintosh, it removes a folder.
Dir.Delete will fail if it attempts delete a directory that has files in it.
sections.mdown_content:
**Dir.Delete** is used to delete the directory specified by the parameter *directoryPathName*. This is the equivalent of doing a **rmdir** in DOS or UNIX. On the Macintosh, it removes a folder.
**Dir.Delete** will fail if it attempts delete a directory that has files in it.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: If the Dir.Delete call fails, then Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.text_content: If the Dir.Delete call fails, then Error.Last will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. Error.LastMsg will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.
sections.mdown_content: If the **Dir.Delete** call fails, then **Error.Last** will return a non-zero value indicating the reason for the failure. **Error.LastMsg** will return a string which contains the textual version of the error.

sections.title: Example
code:
Dir.Delete ("information")
        if Error.Last = eNoError then
            put "Directory delete"
        else
            put "Did not delete the directory."
            put "Error: ", Error.LastMsg
        end if
sections.raw_content: This program deletes the directory called information.
sections.text_content: This program deletes the directory called information.
sections.mdown_content: This program deletes the directory called *information*.

sections.title: Example
sections.raw_content:
An example demonstrating the use of several of the Dir subprograms is available. In this example, a directory is created, a file is written to the directory, an attempt is made to delete the directory, the file is deleted, and then the directory is deleted.

This example demonstrates the use of Dir.Change, Dir.Current, Dir.Create, and Dir.Delete.
sections.text_content:
An example demonstrating the use of several of the Dir subprograms
      is available. In this example, a directory is created, a file is written
      to the directory, an attempt is made to delete the directory, the file is
      deleted, and then the directory is deleted.
      This example demonstrates the use of Dir.Change, 
      Dir.Current, Dir.Create, and Dir.Delete.
sections.mdown_content:
An example demonstrating the use of several of the **Dir** subprogramsis available. In this example, a directory is created, a file is writtento the directory, an attempt is made to delete the directory, the file isdeleted, and then the directory is deleted.
This example demonstrates the use of **Dir.Change**, **Dir.Current**, **Dir.Create**, and **Dir.Delete**.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Dir.Delete, not by calling Delete.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Dir.Delete, not by calling Delete.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Dir.Delete**, not by calling **Delete**.
